clean_data: Systems Administrator span lSystemsspan span lAdministratorspan Systems Administrator Aiken SC Work Experience Systems Administrator Aiken Electric Cooperative Aiken SC March 2017 to Present 1 Works with Cooperative personnel and the SEDC vendor to diagnose and resolve users problems with Accounting Consumer and Capital Credit systems 2 Research construct and generate detailed reports for Management to use with trouble shooting forecasting and planning 3 Active directory structure including creating changing and deleting user accounts per request 4 Provides onsite and remote support for hardware and communications to Pay Stations and Kiosks 5 Maintains SEDC servers generates SEDC specific reports runs endoftheyear accounting and database processes allocations retirement donated capital and abandoned property process Power Distribution Dispatcher Aiken Electric Cooperative Aiken SC December 2013 to March 2017 1 Dispatches field units to handle service interruptions meter connects and disconnects and any other field services as necessary 2 Maintains constant monitoring of all communications in the field between units and stations 3 Monitors SCADA System for alarms indicating system disturbances Issue commands through SCADA system as directed by Cooperative personnel to provide maximum safety to personnel and the public 4 Create work orders runs reports and enters data for various departments as needed RedMan ASRC Federal Charleston SC February 2013 to December 2013 Roleplayers are charged with assisting in the instruction of Federal Law Enforcement Officers by performing a role from a script based scenario Some of these roles require me to act in a combative role for various physical training exercises and other rigorous activities such as being handcuffed frisked tackled struck by rubber baton and shot at by simulated rounds from a pistol The scenarios can take place in classrooms dry docked boats or shoot houses This was a part time position Emergency Medical Technician Intermediate Charleston County EMS May 2008 to December 2013 Administer firstaid treatment and lifesupport care to sick or injured persons in a prehospital setting Perform emergency diagnostic and treatment procedures such as airway management and heart monitoring while en route to a hospital Assess the nature and extent of illness or injury to establish and prioritize medical procedures Maintain vehicles medical and radio communication equipment as well as replenish firstaid equipment and supplies Observe record and report to the nurses and physicians the patients condition or injury the treatment provided and reactions to drugs and treatment Education Masters Degree in ManagementProject Management Colorado State University 2015 to 2017 Bachelors Degree in Business Administration and Management The Citadel 2001 to 2005 Skills System Administrator System Admin Links httpwwwlinkedincominmatthew
